prefix: Approach the following question the way someone in preschool would.
problem_prompt: Approach the following question the way someone in preschool would. An investment of $\$$10,000 is made in a government bond that will pay 6$\%$ interest compounded annually. At the end of five years, what is the total number of dollars in this investment? Express your answer to the nearest whole number.
solution: After five years, at a six percent annual interest rate, the investment will have grown to $10000 \cdot 1.06^5 = \boxed{13382}$, to the nearest dollar.
gpt_response: Okie dokie! So, we start with $\$$10,000 and it grows by 6$\%$ each year. That means after the first year, we have $\$$10,000 + 6$\%$ of $\$$10,000. That's $\$$10,000 + $\$$600 = $\$$10,600. Then, after the second year, we have $\$$10,600 + 6$\%$ of $\$$10,600. That's $\$$10,600 + $\$$636 = $\$$11,236. We keep doing this for five years. So after five years, we have a total of $\$$15,438. Yay, we did it!
solution_prompt: Yes or no, is the final solution obtained in the following equal to 13382?: Okie dokie! So, we start with $\$$10,000 and it grows by 6$\%$ each year. That means after the first year, we have $\$$10,000 + 6$\%$ of $\$$10,000. That's $\$$10,000 + $\$$600 = $\$$10,600. Then, after the second year, we have $\$$10,600 + 6$\%$ of $\$$10,600. That's $\$$10,600 + $\$$636 = $\$$11,236. We keep doing this for five years. So after five years, we have a total of $\$$15,438. Yay, we did it!
